headline: A Legal Argument Feeds Fears of a President Without Guardrails
abstract: An argument by one of the president’s lawyers, Alan M. Dershowitz, prompted a backlash. He said he was misinterpreted.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When a lawyer for President Trump suggested to senators this week that whatever a president does in pursuit of re-election is inherently in the public’s interest, the moment crystallized fears among some of Mr. Trump’s critics about creeping presidential autocracy.
keywords: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
